page.title: 01Introduction To Our Block
page.content: Our Domesday block is situated in a rural part of Derbyshire outside the bounderies of the Peak Park. Much of the area is given over to grazing for sheep and cattle with some crops. A large part of this area has been taken over by the Water Board and is due to be flooded to create the Carsington Reservoir.Work has been delayed by the discovery of a large crack in the newly built dam and there is now some debate as to if, or when, the reservoir will be completed.There are 2 small villages, often thought of as one, called Carsington and Hopton.The population of these two villages is about 200,served by a church, school,shop/post-office and public house.Between the 2 villages is the family home of the Gells, Hopton Hall, famous for its curved wall.
